member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.Controls.ExpandingMenuItem
member.summary: Provides expansion in menus, similar to Word and Exel 2003. The parent menu item must be an ExpandingMenuItem and any children that are selectively shown must be ExpandingMenuItems (or derived classes).
member.remarks:
NOTE: Recently used menu items are not yet recorded.
The SpecialRenderer is responsible for actual painting
The rules for expansion are:
To keep an item visible at all times, set IsStandardItem to true
If an item should be invisible for the user, set AlwaysHidden NOT visible because visible is required to manage the menu.
If a menu would display three or less items, the first three items are displayed
Duplicate separators are removed.
This removes concern about role changes producing duplicate separators, they are removed here.
Not visible separators can not be included, because logic here will make them visible.
Separators that appear at the start are hidden
Separators that appear last are ignored

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.Controls.ExpandingMenuItem.IsStandardItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this item is a standard menu item. Standard menu items are always displayed, regardless of the expand status
member.value: True if the menu item is a standard item, otherwise false
member.returns: True if the menu item is a standard item, otherwise false

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.Controls.ExpandingMenuItem.AlwaysHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this menu item is always hidden for this user.
member.value: True if this user should not see this menu item, otherwise false
member.returns: True if this user should not see this menu item, otherwise false
member.remarks: This is necessary because Visible is used to display menu items. We can't track it because during OnDropDown it's always false.

member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripMenuItem
member.summary:
Enhanced ToolStripMenuItem with the ability to display radio button for checked item.
If CheckOnClick property is set to true and CheckMarkDisplayStyle is set to RadioButton, context menu strip behaves similar way as GroupBox with RadioButton controls. Within same group only one item can be selected.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripMenuItem.AssociatedEnumValue
member.summary: Menu items with radio button display can be used to bind enum values. This property can be used to store associated Enum value.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripMenuItem.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Switches between CheckkBox or RadioButton style.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripMenuItem.RadioButtonGroupName
member.summary: In order to provide behavior similar to RadioButton group, we need a way to mark groups. This property is used for this purpose. All menu items with identical RadioButtonGroupName belong to the same group. It means that clicking one item within group de-selects previously selected item and selects clicked item (only one item can be selected).

member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator
member.summary: Enhanced menu separator. It act as "standard" menu separator with additional ability to display positioned text.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.ShowSeparatorLine
member.summary: If set to 'true' separator line will be displayed in areas not occupied by text. Otherwise only text will be displayed.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.Checked
member.summary: Checked property doesn't make sense for separator, we need to hide base functionality and never call base property in case Checked is used in code. Setting Checked property to any value does nothing.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.CheckState
member.summary: CheckState property doesn't make sense for separator, we need to hide base functionality and never call base property in case CheckState is used in code. Setting CheckState property to any value does nothing.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.DropDown
member.summary: DropDown property doesn't make sense for separator, we need to hide base functionality and never call base property in case DropDown is used in code. Setting DropDown property to any value does nothing.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.DropDownItems
member.summary: DropDownItems property doesn't make sense for separator, we need to hide base functionality and never set base property in case DropDownItems is used in code.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.EnhancedToolStripSeparator.HasDropDownItems
member.summary: Separator cannot have DropDown items, therefore HasDropDownItems always returns false.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMarqueeMenuItem.MarqueeScrollDirection
member.summary: Determines if text is scrolled left-to-right or right-to-left.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMarqueeMenuItem.MinimumTextWidth
member.summary: Value less or equal zero indicates that text area width is defined by with of Text string.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMarqueeMenuItem.RefreshInterval
member.summary:
Determines how often new text position is recalculated. Together with 'ScrollStep' property defines speed of moving text. Smaller value means faster moving text. Text scrolling speed in pixels per seconds can be expressed with the following formula:
1000 * ScrolStep/RefreshInterval
member.remarks: On most computers fastest scrolling speed is achieved for property value around 20 milliseconds. Values smaller than 20 will not increase speed. If faster scrolling is needed, it can be achieved by increasing value of 'ScrollStep' property.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMarqueeMenuItem.StopScrollOnMouseOver
member.summary: When sets to 'true', every time mouse pointer moves over tool strip item, scrolling stops. Otherwise scrolling never stops.

member.summary: Recalculate new text position and and calls Invalidate to repaint.

member.name: M:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMarqueeMenuItem.MeasureText
member.summary: Every time Text or Font properties change this method is called to recalculate commonly used text metrics.

member.name: T:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMenuItemUACSheld
member.summary: A standard tool strip menu item control with UAC shield. Modified from the AeroSuite project.
member.remarks: The shield is extracted from the system with LoadImage if possible. Otherwise the shield will be enabled by sending the BCM_SETSHIELD Message to the control. If the operating system is not Windows Vista or higher, no shield will be displayed as there's no such thing as UAC on the target system -> the shield is obsolete.

member.name: P:Krypton.Toolkit.Suite.Extended.Tool.Strip.Items.ToolStripMenuItemUACSheld.ElevateApplicationOnClick
member.summary: Elevates the current running application to administrator level when button is clicked.
member.remarks: The application/process will restart when clicked.
